summary: The Critical Businesses Preparedness Act (H.R. 3549) amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide a tax credit to critical businesses for electric generators placed in service in high-risk disaster areas.  The credit equals 30% of expenses for generators, with eligible businesses including hospitals, nursing homes, grocery stores, and gas stations. The Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with FEMA, will determine eligible areas and businesses.  The bill also details how the credit interacts with other tax deductions and the effective date of the changes.
